intro: Krokia odiolens, commonly known as the purple marsh orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in Europe. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its striking violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in loose clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. Krokia odiolens thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in peat bogs and fens.
